gate.alignment.gui.actions.impl

Class RemoveAlignmentAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • gate.alignment.gui.actions.impl.AbstractAlignmentAction
      • gate.alignment.gui.actions.impl.RemoveAlignmentAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AlignmentAction

    public class RemoveAlignmentAction
extends AbstractAlignmentAction
    It uses the highlighted annotations from the editor and unaligns them with one other.
    Author:
    niraj

      • executeAlignmentAction

        public void executeAlignmentAction(AlignmentView alignmentView,
                          AlignmentTask task,
                          Set<gate.Annotation> srcAlignedAnnotations,
                          Set<gate.Annotation> tgtAlignedAnnotations,
                          gate.Annotation clickedAnnotation)
                            throws AlignmentException
        non-javadoc
        srcAlignedAnnotations - - annotations from the source document that are being aligned.
        tgtAlignedAnnotations - - annotations from the target document that are being aligned.
        clickedAnnotation - - the last annotation on which the user had right clicked to invoke and execute this action.
        Throws:
        AlignmentException
        See Also:
        AlignmentAction.execute(...)

      • getCaption

        public String getCaption()
        Description copied from interface: AlignmentAction
        Keep this null in order to be called along with the default align action. Otherwise it is shown with this title under the options tab in the alignment editor.
        Returns:
        "Remove Alignment"
